business.headline: Luxury vs affordable housing: What homebuyers prefer during festive seasonThe festive months are traditionally seen as an auspicious time to buy homes. But as real estate sentiment rises across cities, one question stands out — are buyers chasing luxury spaces or choosing affordability amid rising costs?

LIC refutes Washington Post report on $3.9-billion Adani investment planA Washington Post report claimed that the Finance Ministry expedited a proposal directing nearly $3.9 billion (Rs 33,000 crore) in investments from the Life Insurance Corporation of India (LIC) into the Adani Group. The life insurance major rejected the claims as baseless.
Writing a will? These common mistakes can land it in courtFrom Bollywood families to neighbourhood households, inheritance battles have shown that even the most watertight wills can spring leaks.

Reliance says it will comply with new US, Western sanctions on Russian oilThe oil-to-retail behemoth said that it is assessing the implications of restrictions announced by the European Union, the United Kingdom and the United States on crude oil imports from Russia and the export of refined products to Europe.

No trade deals with a gun to our head: Piyush Goyal on India-US trade talksThis special report covers Union Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal's firm message on India's approach to international trade negotiations, particularly regarding the United States. Speaking at the Berlin Global Dialogue, Mr. Goyal made it clear that India will not be rushed into agreements. He stated, 'we do not do deals in a hurry, and we do not go ahead and sign any deals with deadlines or with a gun to our head'. The minister emphasized that for India, trade deals are not merely about tariffs or market access but are long-term partnerships built on trust and mutual respect between nations. This stance comes amid ongoing trade discussions with both the US and the European Union, where India is advocating for fair and equitable agreements that benefit its businesses and economy in the long run.

Don't do deals with gun to our head: Piyush Goyal on trade talks with USIndia is exploring newer markets to reduce the impact of high tariffs and ensure fair trade terms for its exporters, said Piyush Goyal. He noted that India's approach is guided by strategy and self-interest rather than external pressure.
Sensex closes 320 points lower, Nifty below 25,800; HUL down 3%The S&P BSE Sensex lost 344.52 points to close at 84,211.88, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 96.25 points to end at 25,795.15.

Have you been investing in mutual funds the wrong way all this time?Experts say that most investors rely only on absolute returns while judging a mutual fund's performance. They focus on the number showing how much profit they've made, without understanding the factors behind those returns.

US maize import talks rattle Indian farmers as prices fall below MSPReports suggest that if the trade deal goes through and American maize starts entering Indian markets — prices could crash, and farmers may face huge losses.

Sensex tumbles 600 points: Why the stock market is falling todayThe fall came as investors engaged in profit booking following recent gains. After sustained upward movements, it is common for markets to experience short-term corrections as participants secure returns.

Gold ETFs vs physical gold: What smart investors are looking at, explains expertGold may be timeless, but the way Indians invest in it is changing fast. With rising awareness of hidden costs, gold ETFs are gaining traction as a smarter, hassle-free alternative.

How Piyush Pandey made India fall in love with adsPiyush Pandey transformed Indian advertising with heartfelt stories and local flavour. His campaigns blended wit and emotion, leaving a lasting cultural impact.

Remembering Piyush Pandey: The ad legend who made brands immortalFor over four decades, the Jaipur-born storyteller reshaped Indian advertising, turning simple commercials into cultural phenomena and making brands like Fevicol, Cadbury, and Asian Paints inseparable from the Indian consciousness.​

CA explains why saving before spending works best for financial stabilityWhile most people save whatever is left after spending, CA Meenal Goel flips the approach. Her mantra, prioritise savings before expenses, has helped her stay financially secure and stress-free.

Error in your ITR filing? Here's how to correct it with an updated returnRealised there's an error in your ITR after submission? You're not alone. Many taxpayers make small mistakes while filing, but the good news is — you can still correct them through an updated return.

Why the world's central banks are buying gold like never beforeNot just households and investors, but central banks around the globe are buying gold like it's Dhanteras every day. So why are the world's biggest buyers going for bullion? Read on to find out.
Target announces 1,800 job cuts in a decade amid falling salesAll corporate employees in the US have been asked to work from home next week as the company finalises its restructuring process.

Gold, silver prices continue to fall: Is the rally over and what should you do next?After a nine-week winning streak, gold and silver prices are finally losing steam as investors book profits amid a stronger dollar, easing global tensions, and anticipation over key US economic data.
Sensex, Nifty open flat as FMCG stocks offset metal gainsThe S&P BSE Sensex lost 96.63 points to 84,459.77, while the NSE Nifty50 was down by 24.20 points to 25,866.45 as of 9:28 am.

Midwest listing today: Will it give investors profit? See what GMP suggestsMidwest IPO was subscribed 92.36 times overall. The retail portion was booked 25.52 times, the Qualified Institutional Buyers (QIB) category saw 146.99 times, while the Non-Institutional Investors (NII) category was subscribed 176.57 times.

entertainment.headline: Sidharth Shukla's fans will save me: Shehbaz Badesha. He's delusional, say fans 'Bigg Boss 19' wildcard Shehbaz Badesha sparked controversy by claiming backing from late Sidharth Shukla's fans, drawing criticism for allegedly exploiting the actor's legacy.

Rasha Thadani shares throwback pics, calls Raveena Tandon trendsetter on birthday Rasha Thadani wished mother Raveena Tandon a happy birthday on social media with heartfelt messages and throwback photos, calling her the "original trendsetter."

Satish Shah funeral: Inconsolable Rupali Ganguly, Rajesh Kumar in tears Veteran actor Satish Shah, famed for 'Sarabhai vs Sarabhai', received an emotional farewell in Mumbai, with co-stars Rupali Ganguly and Rajesh Kumar visibly moved. He died at 74 on Saturday, October 25.

After Latent row, Samay Raina apologises to people with disabilities on birthday On his birthday today, comedian Samay Raina issued an apology for his jokes about people with disabilities following the 'India's Got Latent' controversy. His statement came in the wake of Supreme Court scrutiny over his remarks.

House of Dynamite review: Kathryn Bigelow crafts a smart but inconsistent thrillerRelease Date:Fri Oct 24, 2025 Kathryn Bigelow's 'A House of Dynamite' is a gripping Netflix political thriller exploring the fallout of a mysterious warhead launch through a Rashomon-style lens. With strong turns by Idris Elba and Rebecca Ferguson, it's a tense study of power and fear, though its pacing and emotional depth occasionally falter.

Amitabh Bachchan and Salman Khan mourn Satish Shah's death: Life lived kingsize Veteran actor and comedian Satish Shah, celebrated for 'Sarabhai vs Sarabhai' and several Bollywood hits, died in Mumbai at 74 due to kidney failure. Tributes poured in from across the industry, with Amitabh Bachchan and Salman Khan remembering his humour, warmth, and timeless charm.

Stalin calls Bison Kaalamaadan another gem in Mari Selvaraj's crown Tamil Nadu Chief Minister MK Stalin praised Mari Selvaraj's 'Bison Kaalamaadan'. The politician called it another gem in the director's crown.

Harshvardhan Rane urges fans to support outsiders with his film and Thamma Harshvardhan Rane encourages moviegoers to watch both 'Ek Deewane Ki Deewaniyat' and 'Thamma', celebrates outsider achievements, and addresses audience influence on nepotism as both films perform well at the box office.

Bigg Boss Tamil 9: Vijay Sethupathi roasts Parvathy, Kamrudin, calls house toxic In the latest episode of 'Bigg Boss Tamil 9', Vijay Sethupathi didn't mince words as he called out contestants for their toxic conduct and lack of discipline inside the house.

Katy Perry, Justin Trudeau walk hand-in-hand in Paris amid dating rumours. Watch Amid dating rumours, a video of singer Katy Perry and former Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau walking hand-in-hand in Paris after celebrating Perry's birthday, has emerged online.
Naya Daur: The trial beyond the tracks A love story lost to circumstance, a film that redefined progress — 'Naya Daur' became both a cinematic triumph and a tragic elegy.

Nikitin Dheer shares emotional note after immersing father Pankaj Dheer's ashes Actor Nikitin Dheer posted a heartfelt message after losing his father, Pankaj Dheer, on October 15. He even immersed the late actor's ashes at Parmarth Niketan Ashram, Rishikesh.

BB19 Episode 63: Salman Khan's ex-wives remark stirs tension for Abhishek Bajaj Salman Khan's indirect comment referencing ex-wives caused tension for Abhishek Bajaj during 'Bigg Boss 19's Weekend Ka Vaar. The host highlighted the intense public scrutiny facing contestants and questioned the dynamics in the house.

Ek Deewane Ki Deewaniyat box office Day 5: Harshvardhan's film hit by Thamma wave 'Ek Deewane Ki Deewaniyat' earned Rs 34 crore in five days despite limited screens. The film outperformed expectations and remained steady alongside bigger releases like 'Thamma'.

Thamma box office Day 5: Ayushmann's film shows growth, eyes Rs 100 crore Ayushmann Khurrana's 'Thamma' achieved over Rs 78 crore at the box office after five days, showing sustained growth. The film is now eyeing Rs 100 crore.

Yeh Jo Hai Zindagi: How Satish Shah's comedy found its template in the '80s show Catering to middle-class homes, 'Yeh Jo Hai Zindagi' let Satish Shah balance a different ditzy character in each episode with the art of keeping it real

Bhuvan Bam announces Bollywood debut with Dharma Productions Bhuvan Bam officially announced his Bollywood debut with Dharma Productions. He shared his excitement and gratitude with a post on Instagram.

Alia Bhatt calls mother Soni Razdan her whole universe in sweet birthday post Actor Alia Bhatt shared a special post to wish her mother, veteran actor Soni Razdan, on her birthday. Take a look at the post here.

Suniel Shetty's dig at Virat, Rohit critics: Legends don't have to prove a point On Saturday, October 25, Suniel Shetty shared a post and praised Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma for silencing their critics with stellar performances during the third One Day International (ODI) against Australia in Sydney.

general news.headline: Poll body to announce pan-India SIR dates, 10-15 states likely in 1st phaseThe poll body is expected to unveil the first phase of the SIR, covering 10 to 15 states, including those scheduled for Assembly elections in 2026. Tamil Nadu, West Bengal, Kerala, Assam, and Puducherry are among the states set to go to the polls next year.
Acid attack on Delhi University student near college, police launch manhuntThe victim, who sustained minor burns on her hand while protecting her face, is being treated at RML Hospital.

Biker killed in Andhra bus fire was drunk, case against him for reckless drivingPolice have booked deceased biker Shivashankar for negligent and reckless driving that led to the Kurnool bus fire killing 20 people. The FIR states he was drunk and lost control before the fatal crash.

Harper's Bazaar Women of the Year Awards 2025: Power, creativity and purposeThe Harper's Bazaar Women of the Year Awards returned to Mumbai for its second India edition, celebrating women of influence across film, fashion, art, and business. From Zeenat Aman and Janhvi Kapoor to Falguni Nayar and Anamika Khanna, the evening honoured icons and innovators shaping India's cultural landscape.

Techies by day, cabbies at night: Why Bengaluru engineers are driving Ola, UberEver had cab drivers in Bengaluru answer your call in fluent corporate lingo? Chances are, they might have been techies. It's not just for the money. Software engineers are driving cabs to beat loneliness at home and drudgery at the office, revealing a problem in our corporate culture.

IND vs BAN Live: Rain stops play after Bangladesh lose both openersIndia (IND) vs Bangladesh (BAN) Live Score, Women's World Cup: Rain has stopped play in Navi Mumbai after Bangladesh lost both their openers, Rubaiya Haider Jhelik and Sumaiya Akter in quick succession.

I'm stitched in love, friendship: Kalli Purie at Harper's Bazaar women awardsKalli Purie, Vice Chairperson and Executive Editor-in-Chief of the India Today Group, spoke about unexpected challenges she faced before appearing at the Harper's Bazaar Women of the Year 2025. Her remarks focused on the strength found in solidarity and support within the fashion community.

Drunk drivers are terrorists: Hyderabad top cop after Andhra bus tragedyDays after 20 people died in a bus fire in Andhra Pradesh's Kurnool, Hyderabad Police Commissioner VS Sajjanar gave a stern message for drunk drivers, saying they were "terrorists". He said no leniency would be given to them for such "acts of terror".

One last time: Rohit Sharma signs off from Australia, heads back to IndiaIndia's star batter Rohit Sharma signed off for one last time from Australia after his heroics during the recently-concluded ODI series. Rohit was adjudged as the Player Of The Series for his heroics with the bat.

India, China direct flights resume after 5-year freeze amid thaw in tiesDirect flights between India and China have resumed after over five years, marking a significant step in restoring connectivity. This move is expected to boost trade, tourism, and diplomatic relations between the two nations.

Cyclone Montha to hit Andhra on Oct 28, Odisha cancels officials' leavesCyclone Montha is expected to make landfall on the Andhra Pradesh coast near Kakinada, between Machilipatnam and Kalingapatnam, on Tuesday evening or night (October 28).

Great people: Trump's big praise for Munir, Sharif, and an Afghanistan mentionTrump called Pakistan's PM Shehbaz Sharif and Army Chief Asim Munir "great people" and vowed to quickly resolve the Pakistan-Afghanistan conflict. Talks between Islamabad and Kabul are set to continue in Istanbul following a temporary calm along the border.

Isro moves LVM3 to launch pad for November 2 liftoff with CMS-03 satelliteThe mission, LVM3-M5, will place the satellite into geosynchronous transfer orbit to enhance multi-band communication across India and nearby oceans. It marks the fifth operational flight of LVM3, following its Chandrayaan-3 success in 2023.

Tejashwi Yadav pledges to throw Waqf Act in dustbin if INDIA bloc wins BiharTejashwi Yadav promises to repeal the Waqf (Amendment) Act if the INDIA bloc wins in Bihar, highlighting his commitment to democracy and communal harmony. He also pledges major development projects for the Seemanchal region, addressing local concerns and governance issues.

JD Vance mocks Zohran Mamdani over 'aunt stopped taking subway after 9/11' remarkZohran Mamdani recounted how his aunt feared riding the subway after 9/11, highlighting anti-Muslim bias. He vowed to openly embrace his faith and fight for equality in New York City. US Vice President JD Vance later mocked Mamdani's remarks, while sharing a clip of the mayoral candidate holding back tears.

Internet obsessed with 'detective' in viral Louvre heist photo, but who's he really?A photo taken outside the Louvre during an ongoing heist investigation is going viral because a sharply dressed man who looked straight out of a detective film has become the centre of attention. Why Sophie Devine denied teammates from giving guard honour before England tieNew Zealand captain Sophie Devine explained why she refused her teammates from giving a guard of honour before the England tie on Sunday, October 26. Devine called time on her ODI career with the game in Vizag.

Sophie Ecclestone injured before semis? Nat Sciver-Brunt updates on England spinner Women's World Cup, ENG vs NZ: Left-arm spinner Sophie Ecclestone bowled only four balls in her spell in New Zealand's innings in Visakhapatnam before she went off the park due to a shoulder injury.

Riyan Parag leads Assam to script unwanted record in Ranji Trophy history Riyan Parag starred with the ball as Assam fell to a heavy defeat against Services, scripting an unwanted Ranji Trophy record despite his valiant efforts.

Celebrate Virat Kohli, let him find balance in life at end of career: AB de Villiers AB de Villiers has urged the fans to celebrate Virat Kohli and support him, irrespective of what decision he makes in terms of his career. Kohli came back into form during the third ODI against Australia.

Harmanpreet Kaur is my idol, 171 against Australia inspired me: Sobhana Mostary Women's World Cup 2025: In an exclusive interview with India Today Digital, Bangladesh batter Sobhana Mostary said that she idolises Harmanpreet Kaur and started following her since the 171-run knock against Australia in the semi-finals of the 2017 edition in Derby.

Arne Slot gives bizarre reason for Liverpool's pricey yet poor form Liverpool's Premier League title defence has hit a worrying slump after four straight defeats. Arne Slot blamed the team's away-heavy schedule and rival tactics for their poor form, calling it a key reason behind the slide.

Australian Cricketers Molested On Indore Street | Molester Arrested This special report covers the shocking incident in Indore where two Australian women cricketers, in India for the ICC Women's World Cup, were stalked and molested. According to the Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI) Secretary Devajit Saikia, 'It is a very unfortunate incident that brings disrepute'. The incident occurred when the players were walking from their hotel to a cafe, prompting immediate police action. An FIR was lodged and the accused, identified as Akil Khan, was arrested based on a bystander's tip. The report delves into the political fallout and the serious questions raised about the safety of international athletes and women in India, an act that has brought global shame during a major tournament.

Arjun Erigaisi, Praggnanandhaa, Vidit Gujrathi are among the other big names in the tournament.

Who is Uma Chetry? All you need to know about India's ODI debutant from AssamUma Chetry made her ODI debut for India against Bangladesh in the Women's World Cup. Meanwhile, India have won the toss and chose to bowl first.

Are ODIs boring? Ex-cricketer calls for more multi-laterals after IND vs AUSFormer cricketer Aakash Chopra believes that bilateral ODIs have lost their charm and hold no meaning at all. Chopra wants the boards to come together and play multi-lateral series more.

Belinda Bencic puts behind 10-year-old heartbreak to claim titleSwiss star Belinda Bencic capped her comeback with a fairytale triumph at the 2025 Pan Pacific Open, defeating Czech rising star Linda Noskova 6–2, 6–3 in Tokyo to claim her 10th WTA title.

Same same but different: Kane Williamson goes Virat Kohli route on ODI returnKane Williamson returned to ODI cricket but was dismissed for a duck as New Zealand edged England by four wickets. It had a similar parallel to Virat Kohli, who had recently made his return to international cricket.

Abhishek Nayar set to be named as KKR head coach : ReportFormer India assistant coach Abhishek Nayar is set to take over the Kolkata Knight Riders. Nayar, who coached UP Warriorz last season in the WPL is reportedly communicated the decision last week by the franchise.

Emotional Sophie Devine breaks down in tears in final ODINew Zealand captain Sophie Devine was moved to tears at the start of her final ODI match. Devine said that she would try to play the game with a smile on her face.

Harry Brook's ferocious 135 rescues England from embarrassment vs New ZealandEngland captain Harry Brook scored a career-best 135 to rescue his side after a top-order collapse against New Zealand in the first ODI. His innings helped England reach a defendable total of 223 in 35.2 overs from being 56/6.

Sophie Devine urges better planning in World Cups after rain-hit Sri Lanka matchesNew Zealand skipper Sophie Devine has urged the ICC to plan future Women's World Cups more thoughtfully after multiple rain-hit matches in Sri Lanka derailed her team's semi-final hopes in what was her final ODI campaign.

Australia tour done, what's next for Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma?Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli starred in India's consolation win against Australia at the SCG. With the tour Down Under done, what's next for the two stalwarts?

Alyssa Healy in doubt for semi-final against India, hints Australia coachAustralia captain Alyssa Healy is in doubt for the semi-final match against India, hinted head coach Shelley Nitschke. Healy suffered a calf strain after Australia's match against Bangladesh.

Inspired by Harmanpreet Kaur, Sobhana Mostary vows to make Bangladesh world beatersWomen's World Cup Exclusive: Bangladesh's campaign in the tournament has been a story of near misses, but Sobhana Mostary has stood out as one of their most reliable batters. A product of the BKSP – the same institution that produced stars like Shakib Al Hasan and Litton Das - the Rangpur-born cricketer now aims to make the Tigresses a force to reckon with on the world stage.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
